Vendors

Overview

To avoid naming collisions, kits must be prepended by a vendor name. The vendor name is an alphanumeric text string and must be less than 32 characters. Examples of valid vendor names: 

Foo
Foo12
FooBar

TODO: Describe how to register your vendor name with sedonadev.org

Your kit names must be prepended with your vendor name. The vendor name is treated as case-insensitive when it is verified, all these are valid kit names for a kit owned by the Foo vendor: 

foo-control
fooControl
FooControl

Likewise, the prefix must match the vendor name specificed in the kit manifest (ignoring case): 

<kitManifest
   name="foo-control"
   checksum="40464bf3"
   hasNatives="false"
   doc="false"
   version="1.0.5"
   vendor="Foo"
   description="Basic function block library"
>
